verses.verse: אֵיכָ֣ה׀ <WH349> 'ei-Chah how יָשְׁבָ֣ה <WH3427> ya-she-Vah sit בָדָ֗ד <WH910> va-Dad, solitary הָעִיר֙ <WH5892> ha-'Ir How doth the city רַבָּ֣תִי <WH7227> rab-Ba-ti [that was] full עָ֔ם <WH5971> 'Am, of people הָיְתָ֖ה <WH1961> ha-ye-Tah has become כְּאַלְמָנָ֑ה <WH490> ke-'al-ma-Nah; [how] is she become as a widow רַבָּ֣תִי <WH7227> rab-Ba-ti she [that was] great בַגּוֹיִ֗ם <WH1471> vag-go-Yim, among the nations שָׂרָ֙תִי֙ <WH8282> sa-Ra-ti [and] princess בַּמְּדִינ֔וֹת <WH4082> bam-me-di-Not, among the provinces הָיְתָ֖ה <WH1961> ha-ye-Tah has become לָמַֽס׃ <WH4522> la-Mas. [how] is she become tributary ס sa-Mek

בָּכ֨וֹ <WH1058> ba-Cho She weepeth תִבְכֶּ֜ה <WH1058> tiv-Keh sore בַּלַּ֗יְלָה <WH3915> bal-Lay-lah, in the night וְדִמְעָתָהּ֙ <WH1832> ve-dim-'a-Tah and her tears עַ֣ל <WH5921> 'al are on לֶֽחֱיָ֔הּ <WH3895> le-che-Yah, [are] on her cheeks אֵֽין־ <WH369> 'ein- has לָ֥הּ lah מְנַחֵ֖ם <WH5162> me-na-Chem she hath none to comfort מִכָּל־ <WH3605> mik-kol all אֹהֲבֶ֑יהָ <WH157> 'o-ha-Vei-ha; among all her lovers כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- All רֵעֶ֙יהָ֙ <WH7453> re-'Ei-ha [her] all her friends בָּ֣גְדוּ <WH898> Ba-ge-du have dealt treacherously בָ֔הּ Vah, הָ֥יוּ <WH1961> Ha-yu have become לָ֖הּ <WH99999> lah לְאֹיְבִֽים׃ <WH341> le-'o-ye-Vim. with her they are become her enemies ס sa-Mek

גָּֽלְתָ֨ה <WH1540> gal-Tah is gone into captivity יְהוּדָ֤ה <WH3063> ye-hu-Dah Judah מֵעֹ֙נִי֙ <WH6040> me-'O-ni because of affliction וּמֵרֹ֣ב <WH7230> u-me-Ro and because of great עֲבֹדָ֔ה <WH5656> 'a-vo-Dah, servitude הִ֚יא <WH1931> hi She יָשְׁבָ֣ה <WH3427> ya-she-Vah she dwelleth בַגּוֹיִ֔ם <WH1471> vag-go-Yim, among the heathen לֹ֥א <WH3808> lo no מָצְאָ֖ה <WH4672> ma-tze-'Ah she findeth מָנ֑וֹחַ <WH4494> ma-No-ach; no rest כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- All רֹדְפֶ֥יהָ <WH7291> ro-de-Fei-ha all her persecutors הִשִּׂיג֖וּהָ <WH5381> his-si-Gu-ha overtook בֵּ֥ין <WH996> bein the midst הַמְּצָרִֽים׃ <WH4712> ham-me-tza-Rim. her between the straits ס sa-Mek

דַּרְכֵ֨י <WH1870> dar-Chei The ways צִיּ֜וֹן <WH6726> tzi-Yon of Zion אֲבֵל֗וֹת <WH57> a-ve-Lot, do mourn מִבְּלִי֙ <WH1097> mib-be-Li no בָּאֵ֣י <WH935> ba-'Ei because none come מוֹעֵ֔ד <WH4150> mo-'Ed, to the solemn feasts כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- All שְׁעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ <WH8179> she-'a-Rei-ha all her gates שֽׁוֹמֵמִ֔ין <WH8074> sho-me-Min, are desolate כֹּהֲנֶ֖יהָ <WH3548> ko-ha-Nei-ha her priests נֶאֱנָחִ֑ים <WH584> ne-'e-na-Chim; sigh בְּתוּלֹתֶ֥יהָ <WH1330> be-tu-lo-Tei-ha her virgins נּוּג֖וֹת <WH3013> nu-Got are afflicted וְהִ֥יא <WH1931> ve-Hi herself מַר־ <WH4751> mar- angry לָֽהּ׃ <WH99999> Lah. ס sa-Mek

הָי֨וּ <WH1961> ha-Yu have become צָרֶ֤יהָ <WH6862> tza-Rei-ha Her adversaries לְרֹאשׁ֙ <WH7218> le-roSh are the chief אֹיְבֶ֣יהָ <WH341> 'o-ye-Vei-ha her enemies שָׁל֔וּ <WH7951> sha-Lu, prosper כִּֽי־ <WH3588> ki- For יְהוָ֥ה <WH3068> Yah-weh for the LORD הוֹגָ֖הּ <WH3013> ho-Gah hath afflicted עַ֣ל <WH5921> 'al Because רֹב־ <WH7230> rov- her for the multitude פְּשָׁעֶ֑יהָ <WH6588> pe-sha-'Ei-ha; of her transgressions עוֹלָלֶ֛יהָ <WH5768> o-la-Lei-ha her children הָלְכ֥וּ <WH1980> ha-le-Chu are gone שְׁבִ֖י <WH7628> she-Vi into captivity לִפְנֵי־ <WH6440> lif-nei- before צָֽר׃ <WH6862> Tzar. the enemy ס sa-Mek

זָֽכְרָ֣ה <WH2142> za-che-Rah remembered יְרוּשָׁלִַ֗ם <WH3389> ye-ru-sha-Lim, Jerusalem יְמֵ֤י <WH3117> ye-Mei in the days עָנְיָהּ֙ <WH6040> 'a-ne-Yah of her affliction וּמְרוּדֶ֔יהָ <WH4788> u-me-ru-Dei-ha, and of her miseries כֹּ֚ל <WH3605> kol all מַחֲמֻדֶ֔יהָ <WH4262> ma-cha-mu-Dei-ha, all her pleasant things אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> 'a-Sher after הָי֖וּ <WH1961> ha-Yu were from מִ֣ימֵי <WH3117> Mi-mei that she had in the days קֶ֑דֶם <WH6924> Ke-dem; of old בִּנְפֹ֧ל <WH5307> bin-Fol fell עַמָּ֣הּ <WH5971> 'am-Mah when her people בְּיַד־ <WH3027> be-yad- into the hand צָ֗ר <WH6862> Tzar, of the enemy וְאֵ֤ין <WH369> ve-'Ein and no עוֹזֵר֙ <WH5826> o-Zer and none did help לָ֔הּ <WH99999> Lah, רָא֣וּהָ <WH7200> ra-'U-ha saw צָרִ֔ים <WH6862> tza-Rim, her the adversaries שָׂחֲק֖וּ <WH7832> sa-cha-Ku her [and] did mock עַ֥ל <WH5921> 'al at מִשְׁבַּתֶּֽהָ׃ <WH4868> mish-bat-Te-ha. at her sabbaths ס sa-Mek

חֵ֤טְא <WH2399> chet hath grievously חָֽטְאָה֙ <WH2398> cha-te-'Ah sinned יְר֣וּשָׁלִַ֔ם <WH3389> ye-Ru-sha-Lim, Jerusalem עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- and כֵּ֖ן <WH3651> ken after that לְנִידָ֣ה <WH5206> le-ni-Dah therefore she is removed הָיָ֑תָה <WH1961> ha-Ya-tah; has become כָּֽל־ <WH3605> kal- All מְכַבְּדֶ֤יהָ <WH3513> me-chab-be-Dei-ha all that honoured הִזִּיל֙וּהָ֙ <WH2107> hiz-zi-Lu-ha her despise כִּי־ <WH3588> ki- her Because רָא֣וּ <WH7200> ra-'U her because they have seen עֶרְוָתָ֔הּ <WH6172> 'er-va-Tah, her nakedness גַּם־ <WH1571> gam- Even הִ֥יא <WH1931> hi herself נֶאֶנְחָ֖ה <WH584> ne-'en-Chah yea she sigheth וַתָּ֥שָׁב <WH7725> vat-Ta-shov and turneth אָחֽוֹר׃ <WH268> a-Chor. backward ס sa-Mek

טֻמְאָתָ֣הּ <WH2932> tum-'a-Tah Her filthiness בְּשׁוּלֶ֗יהָ <WH7757> be-shu-Lei-ha, [is] in her skirts לֹ֤א <WH3808> lo did not זָֽכְרָה֙ <WH2142> za-che-Rah she remembereth אַחֲרִיתָ֔הּ <WH319> 'a-cha-ri-Tah, not her last end וַתֵּ֣רֶד <WH3381> vat-Te-red therefore she came down פְּלָאִ֔ים <WH6382> pe-la-'Im, wonderfully אֵ֥ין <WH369> 'ein has מְנַחֵ֖ם <WH5162> me-na-Chem she had no comforter לָ֑הּ Lah; רְאֵ֤ה <WH7200> re-'Eh behold יְהוָה֙ <WH3068> Yah-weh O LORD אֶת־ <WH853> 'et- עָנְיִ֔י <WH6040> 'a-ne-Yi, my affliction כִּ֥י <WH3588> ki for הִגְדִּ֖יל <WH1431> hig-Dil hath magnified אוֹיֵֽב׃ <WH341> o-Yev. for the enemy ס sa-Mek

יָדוֹ֙ <WH3027> ya-Do his hand פָּ֣רַשׂ <WH6566> Pa-ras hath spread out צָ֔ר <WH6862> Tzar, The adversary עַ֖ל <WH5921> 'al Over כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- all מַחֲמַדֶּ֑יהָ <WH4261> ma-cha-mad-Dei-ha; upon all her pleasant things כִּֽי־ <WH3588> ki- for רָאֲתָ֤ה <WH7200> ra-'a-Tah for she hath seen גוֹיִם֙ <WH1471> go-Yim [that] the heathen בָּ֣אוּ <WH935> Ba-'u entered מִקְדָּשָׁ֔הּ <WH4720> mik-da-Shah, into her sanctuary אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> 'a-Sher whom צִוִּ֔יתָה <WH6680> tziv-Vi-tah, whom thou didst command לֹא־ <WH3808> lo- should not יָבֹ֥אוּ <WH935> ya-Vo-'u [that] they should not enter בַקָּהָ֖ל <WH6951> vak-ka-Hal into thy congregation לָֽךְ׃ <WH99999> Lach. ס sa-Mek

כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- All עַמָּ֤הּ <WH5971> 'am-Mah All her people נֶאֱנָחִים֙ <WH584> ne-'e-na-Chim sigh מְבַקְּשִׁ֣ים <WH1245> me-vak-ke-Shim they seek לֶ֔חֶם <WH3899> Le-chem, bread נָתְנ֧וּ <WH5414> na-te-Nu they have given; מַחֲמֹודֵּיהֶם ma-cha-mo-dei-hem כמַחֲמַדֵּיהֶ֛ם <WH4262> ma-cha-mad-dei-Hem pleasant thing קבְּאֹ֖כֶל <WH400> be-'O-chel for meat לְהָשִׁ֣יב <WH7725> le-ha-Shiv to relieve נָ֑פֶשׁ <WH5315> Na-fesh; the soul רְאֵ֤ה <WH7200> re-'Eh see יְהוָה֙ <WH3068> Yah-weh O LORD וְֽהַבִּ֔יטָה <WH5027> ve-hab-Bi-tah, and consider כִּ֥י <WH3588> ki For הָיִ֖יתִי <WH1961> ha-Yi-ti I am זוֹלֵלָֽה׃ <WH2151> zo-le-Lah. for I am become vile ס sa-Mek

ל֣וֹא <WH3808> Lo nothing אֲלֵיכֶם֮ <WH413> 'a-lei-Chem to כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- all עֹ֣בְרֵי <WH5674> oe-rei [Is it] nothing to you all ye that pass דֶרֶךְ֒ <WH1870> de-reCh along הַבִּ֣יטוּ <WH5027> hab-Bi-tu behold וּרְא֗וּ <WH7200> u-re-'U, and see אִם־ <WH518> 'im- if יֵ֤שׁ <WH3426> yesh if there be מַכְאוֹב֙ <WH4341> mach-'Ov any sorrow כְּמַכְאֹבִ֔י <WH4341> ke-mach-'o-Vi, like unto my sorrow אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> 'a-Sher Which עוֹלַ֖ל <WH5953> o-Lal which is done לִ֑י Li; אֲשֶׁר֙ <WH834> 'a-Sher Which הוֹגָ֣ה <WH3013> ho-Gah hath afflicted יְהוָ֔ה <WH3068> Yah-weh, unto me wherewith the LORD בְּי֖וֹם <WH3117> be-Yom [me] in the day חֲר֥וֹן <WH2740> cha-Ron of his fierce אַפּֽוֹ׃ <WH639> ap-Po. anger ס sa-Mek

[and] faint ס sa-Mek

סִלָּ֨ה <WH5541> sil-Lah hath trodden under foot כָל־ <WH3605> chol all אַבִּירַ֤י׀ <WH47> 'ab-bi-Rai all my mighty אֲדֹנָי֙ <WH136> 'a-do-Nai The Lord בְּקִרְבִּ֔י <WH7130> be-kir-Bi, [men] in the midst קָרָ֥א <WH7121> ka-Ra of me he hath called עָלַ֛י <WH5921> 'a-Lai against מוֹעֵ֖ד <WH4150> mo-'Ed an assembly לִשְׁבֹּ֣ר <WH7665> lish-Bor against me to crush בַּחוּרָ֑י <WH970> ba-chu-Rai; my young men גַּ֚ת <WH1660> gat [as] in a winepress דָּרַ֣ךְ <WH1869> da-Rach hath trodden אֲדֹנָ֔י <WH136> 'a-do-Nai, the Lord לִבְתוּלַ֖ת <WH1330> liv-tu-Lat the virgin בַּת־ <WH1323> bat- the daughter יְהוּדָֽה׃ <WH3063> ye-hu-Dah. of Judah ס sa-Mek

עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- For אֵ֣לֶּה׀ <WH428> 'El-leh these אֲנִ֣י <WH589> 'a-Ni I בוֹכִיָּ֗ה <WH1058> vo-chi-Yah, For these [things] I weep עֵינִ֤י׀ <WH5869> 'ei-Ni mine eye עֵינִי֙ <WH5869> 'ei-Ni mine eye יֹ֣רְדָה <WH3381> Yo-re-dah runneth down מַּ֔יִם <WH4325> Ma-yim, with water כִּֽי־ <WH3588> ki- Because רָחַ֥ק <WH7368> ra-Chak is far מִמֶּ֛נִּי <WH4480> mi-Men-ni is a מְנַחֵ֖ם <WH5162> me-na-Chem because the comforter מֵשִׁ֣יב <WH7725> me-Shiv that should relieve נַפְשִׁ֑י <WH5315> naf-Shi; my soul הָי֤וּ <WH1961> ha-Yu become בָנַי֙ <WH1121> va-Nai from me my children שֽׁוֹמֵמִ֔ים <WH8074> sho-me-Mim, are desolate כִּ֥י <WH3588> ki Because גָבַ֖ר <WH1396> ga-Var prevailed אוֹיֵֽב׃ <WH341> o-Yev. because the enemy ס sa-Mek
